required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Paramedian Spinal Anaesthesia : Comparison Between Land-mark Guided Technique and Real-time Ultrasound Guided Technique.
clinical_study.official_title: Paramedian Spinal Anaesthesia for Orthopaedic Knee Surgery: Comparison Between Conventional Blind Land-mark Guided Technique and Real-time Ultrasound Guided Technique: a Randomized Controlled Trial.

brief_summary.textblock: To identify the value of using the ultrasound in applying a commonly used regional anaesthetic procedure (spinal anaesthesia) when compared with the conventional landmark guided approach, regarding the efficiency of the anaesthetic technique, incidence of associated common complications and patient's satisfaction.

primary_outcome.time_frame: during the time taken for introducing the regional anesthetic technique in the intraoperative period

secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time taken for introducing the regional anesthetic technique in the intraoperative period

secondary_outcome.measure: The visibility of the ligamentum flavum-dura mater complex by the US.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time taken for introducing the regional anesthetic technique in the intraoperative period
during the time taken for introducing the regional anesthetic technique in the intraoperative period

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of paraesthesia and backache
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time taken for introducing the regional anesthetic technique in the intraoperative period

secondary_outcome.measure: The incidence of failure of introducing spinal anaesthesia using each of the study techniques.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: during the time taken for introducing the regional anesthetic technique in the intraoperative period

secondary_outcome.measure: Patient's satisfaction score regarding the anaesthetic technique
secondary_outcome.time_frame: within 2 hours in the postoperative period

intervention.description: land mark guided paramedian spinal anesthesia
real time ultrasound guided paramedian spinal anesthesia

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
1. ASA physical status I-II patients
2. Patient's consented approval
3. Males or Females
4. Aged 18-60 years old
5. Body mass index less than 30
6. Scheduled for orthopaedic knee surgeries
Exclusion Criteria:
1. Age less than 18, and more than 60 years
2. Body mass index more than 30
3. Patient refusal or failure to obtain consent
4. Patient in whom spinal anaesthesia is contraindicated (infection at the site of needle insertion, coagulopathy reflected by values of INR≥ 1.2 or platelets count≤ 75.000, or receiving oral anticoagulants)
5. Known sensitivity to local anaesthetics
6. Pre-existing neurological disorder or neuromuscular disease
7. Clinically obvious or known spinal deformity or previous spinal surgery
